docblock.description: clsXMLFormUtils.php, Styroform XML Form Controller XML Form Generator and Validator.
Convenience methods for XML Form.
Constructor creates a new XML Document
Create a datetime value from a compound form element.
Remove the querystring variables "page" and "sort" from the URL
Determine if a form element is a compound element
Return an array containing the parts for a compound element
docblock.long-description: Parts are Name and Type

docblock.description: Adds an element to an array
Dumps the current document into an XML Output
Dumps the current document into an XML Output
XMLSelect.php, Styroform XML Form Controller XML Form Generator and Validator Retrieves lists for select elements, either from a database via ORM, or directly from SQL/Query files.
Responsible for formatting db data into select list elements.
Base Table for the Select Query
Integer of Primary Key for Deletion
Buffer of Results from Query
Class Constructor
Dumps DB Select Results to an XML Formatted Outpu
Returns and array of results in "sel_key", "sel_value" format
Returns and array of results in "sel_key", "sel_value" format
Returns results from a WTVR XML Query
Returns results from a SQL Query, using standardized columnar names
docblock.long-description: select {$table}_id as sel_key, {$table}_name as sel_value from {$table}

docblock.description: Returns results from a Dadoo SQL Query, using standardized columnar names
Returns results from a Dadoo SQL Query, using standardized columnar names
Updates an item with a new "name" value
Inserts an item with a "name" value
Deletes an item with a specific ID
Returns results from a SQL Query, using standardized columnar names
docblock.long-description: select {$table}_id as sel_key, {$table}_name as sel_value from {$table}

docblock.description: Returns string-match results from a SQL Query, using standardized columnar names, and a letter
docblock.long-description:
select {$table}_id as sel_key, {$table}_name as sel_value from {$table}
    and LOWER(SUBSTRING({$table}_name FROM 1 FOR 1)) = LOWER('A')

docblock.description: Output standard XML Headers for XML Dump
Output xml format data for AJAX Queries
clsFormValidator.php, Styroform XML Form Controller XML Form Generator and Validator.
The Form Validator class, responsible for reading and validating form elements. This class is replicated in JS for client-side validation.
Count of errors discovered during validation
Parent form, passed as an XML Doc
Array of XML Form Elements in the form
XML Object Containing Validation Types
Path to XML File for XML Validators
XML Object Containing "Compound" Form Elements
docblock.long-description: These elements are normally dates, with multiple formelements, i.e. Day, Month, Year as separate select lists

docblock.description: Path to XML File for XML Compound Element Types
The current form element being validated
Validation Type of the current form element
Required param of the current form element
The name of the current form element
The value of the current form element
The size attribute of the current form element
The type attribute of the current form element
Potential values for a Select/Checkradio element
Name marker for compound elements, is split from compound name using a pipe delimiter
Type marker for compound elements, is split from compound type using a pipe delimiter
Attribute marker for compound elements, is split from compound type using a pipe delimiter
The validation pattern for a specific form element, taken from ObjXMLValidDoc
Result of regex validation on a specific form element
If a form element is to be validated, this is set to true
Should validation errors be displayed to the end user
Result of all form validation, skipping elements with VNN or FALSE requirement
Should the Validator be run in debug mode. Debug STOPS ALL OUTPUT.
Should the debug output be send in CLI Color Mode
Configuration variable declaring the base location of XML Assets
Array of form element types to be used in "select", selectdb, state, country, etc...
Array of form element types to be used in "compounds", monthday, monthyear, etc...
Array of Dynamic Selects for select and checkradio values
Specific location used in framework integrations
Array of fields that encountered an error, name only
Form Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - Framework location of module or widget

docblock.description: Loads the validator regex patterns from an external XML File
Loads the compound and select types from an external XML File
Assigns the select types to an array from the Parsed XML Object
Assigns the compound types to an array from the Parsed XML Object
docblock.long-description: @name setCompounds

docblock.description: Assigns the Parent XML Form and pulls all form elements onto the local nodelist
Iterate through the form elements and validate each using the regex patterns
Decode the HMAC Signature and see if we're posting from the right place
Create an Error Element in the Form
Parse the Current Element Node and assign attributes locally
docblock.long-description:
Attributes are:

 VTIP - Validation Type
    REQUIRED - TRUE|FALSE|VNN (Value Not Null)
    NAME - Name of Current Element
    SIZE - Used for Text Element Validation
    TYPE - Type of Element

docblock.description: Reads the values of the current item, if a select, or compound element
Validates a form element's value against the regex pattern, or optionally a function if available.
Determines which function to call to perform validation, using the element VTIP attribute. Note, js validation returns an identical function name for PHP.
Pulls the actual regular expression from the Validation Types
Generic validation function for non-compliant form element validation
Validates File Input Elements
Validates Text Input Elements
Validates Textarea Input Elements
Validates Checkbox Input Elements
Validates Radio Input Elements
Validates Select Input Elements
Validates Multiple Select Input Elements
Validates Submit Elements
Used to assign array values from select arrays into a more managable format
Counts the number of checked elements were submitted in a form
Determines with field index is selected in a checkradio form element
Pushes an error onto the error array, and increments the error count
docblock.long-description: @name createError

docblock.description: Deprecated, pulled from the JS Validator Prototype
docblock.long-description: @name resetField

docblock.description: Sets the state of the form validator for this form. If any errors are found, this is set to false
Applies and error attribute to the "CLASS" subnode of the XML Form Element
Applies and error attribute to the "DISPLAYCLASS" subnode of the XML Form Element
Sets the default value of a form element
Convenience method to determine if an element is a select element
Convenience method to determine if an element is a multiple select element
Convenience method to determine if an element is a compound element
Returns the compound subtype of a specific compound type
Performs a regular expression match
Performs a regex replace on a string
Prints debug messages either in Color CLI format, or as text

docblock.description: clsXMLForm.php, Styroform XML Form Controller XML Form Generator and Validator.
Responsible for controlling the form, drawing, calling the validator, adding "Items" and "ItemLists", and navigating through formsets.
Flag to return transformed forms as XML Objects
Array of XML Forms in an ordered FormSet
Retains the number of the currently displayed form in the Formset Starts at zero
Retains the name of the current form controlled by this object Allows for multiple form controllers on a specific page.
docblock.long-description: All forms within a formset should have the same name

docblock.description: Object container for the XML Session configuration
File location of the XML Session configuration
Array of Session variables that are allowed to translate to form variables, parsed from @link $objSessionDoc
Object container for the current Form, as an XML Object
Object container for the current Form XSL Transformation Document
Object container for the XML Validators configuration
File location of the current XML Form
File location of the current XSL Transformation Document
Status of the current XML Form Document
Status of the current XML Form Validation
Status of the current XML Form Validation
Control Variable allowing form controllers to explicitly state that the form is not validated. used for error generation
Indicator for FormSet status, true means form is not at position 0 or end position
Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to add HTTP GET variables to form as hidden variables
Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to add HTTP POST variables to form as hidden variables
Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to force population of hidden values from an "Item", even if the form element isn't already in the form
Append Timestamp to XML Form Objext

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: Timestamps are appended now by default

docblock.description: Object List of element types that require more than one form element, i.e. day/month/year (3)

tag.name: deprecated
tag.description: Compounded form elements are defined in StyroformTypes

docblock.description: Configuration variable read from current form, declaring whether to output the form as formelements or formvariables Not currently supported
Optional Array containing the name and XMLDocument List for the Formset, read generally from either $GLOBALS or from within the WTVR Module, if WTVR
Optional XML Root Node Variable, for forms inside of existing xml schemas
Removes the doctype declaration from a returned XML Object
Puts execution in debug mode
Puts the validator in Debug mode
N-Dimensional Array for adding Lists to the XML Tree, used in CRUD operations.
2-Dimensional Array for adding values to the Form The first element being the item name, the second being the value
Modifications to specific elements that are performed after the dom has been procesed.
docblock.long-description: For instance, if you need to remove an element, or add an attribute, rather than adding it to the Object Queue that in the "Mods" and it'll be processed after the various other args are applied

docblock.description: A generic array in which to place other form elements.
Hidden Values that match form element names aren't added by default, this boolean will force that
List of elements to skip in validation from the Post Vars
An array of elements that should be removed from the XML Form Object
An Array of "lookup" arrays for Select Lists to pull from, if not in XML or Database Lookup
A list of element types that will have array options generated for them
Configuration variable for XML Return Object
Configuration variable declaring the parent module name from within parent Framework
Configuration variable declaring the base location of XML Assets
Unclear what this is, deprecated
Determines the form page increment
Form Constructor, determines the Formset and other globals using the $formsettings or from the formconf.php file, which is discovered using the conf as it's location.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - Array with both Formset, and XSL Doc

tag.name: param
tag.description: - Name of the WTVR Module, defaults to null

docblock.description: Reads the Session Variable Configuration Document, and assigns them to an array The format of this file is below, and it should be located in a secure location along the php include path ("xml/StyroformSessionVars.xml").
docblock.long-description: Any session variables named in this document will be added to the form by default.

docblock.description: Serialize the Session Variable Configuration Document
Get the action, which is equivalent to the user's click. Buttons and image clicks are transformed using this method. Reads through all post data looking for a submit.
docblock.long-description: This method has been replaced by getFormMethod()

docblock.description: Main controller method, used to render a form into either XML or a string.
Increments the current form, with an optional param to skip form validation.
Tests whether the form was posted or not from a normal form view.
Tests whether the form was posted or not from the CRUD List view. If a list has a form wrapper, elements in the list can contain checkboxes for multi-item deletion.
Similar to getAction(), but only looks for specific keys, which is equivalent to the user's click.
docblock.long-description: Buttons and image clicks, are deduced using this method.

docblock.description: Boolean to test which page is currently active
Creates the objXMLDoc from an XML Form, looking in the following order for, Widget Name/Doc, ROOTNODE (from another XML File)

Processes all the items in the process queue, in the order of ERROR, SELECT OPTS, POST, GET, SESSION, LIST, MODS, ITEM, HMAC, CONTAINER, DATES, then removes any items, and finally does an XSL Transformation if needed, and then returns either a string, or an XML Object
Creates an XMLFormValidator, tests the form against the available Validators, and returns the results of the Validation.
Updates the form with the current page, and name
Adds POST Variables to the form, appending if the form doesn't contain an appropriate formelement container.
Adds an element to the removal queue, using the name element from the form element
Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum Lorem Ipsum

 $fpo = something();
 $fpo = something();
 $fpo = something();
 $fpo = something();

docblock.description: Adds an element to the error array stored in Session
docblock.long-description: If the business process rules need to flag a specific field, use this to set the tuple, and it will be reflected in the XML.

docblock.description: Adds QueryString Variables to the form, appending if the form doesn't contain an appropriate formelement container.
Set the "errornotice" form element to visible.
Add the global "errors" element group to the Form XML Object and place any session "errors" into the group as separate elements.
docblock.long-description: Also, rewinds the form to the previous page, as these errors stop the form from being successfully processed

docblock.description: Mark a specific form element as having an error.
Add appropriate session variables to the Form Object
Add an Element Group Form Element Container

tag.name: param
tag.description: - ID to put in "id" attribute, optional

docblock.description: Forces an error into the Form, using the Form Validator
docblock.long-description: This passes the current Dynarray to the Validator

docblock.description: Deletes and element from the Form XML Object
docblock.long-description:
Uses the "items_to_remove" array to pull specific items from the Form.

 XMLForm -> removeItem("someelementname");

docblock.description: Adds a standard Form Element Group, with a child Form Element
docblock.long-description:
<FORMELEMENTGROUP>
   <FORMELEMENT>
     <NAME></NAME>
     <DISPLAY></DISPLAY>
     <TYPE></TYPE>
     <DEFAULT></DEFAULT>
     <CLASS></CLASS>
     <VTIP></VTIP>
     <REQUIRED></REQUIRED>
     <DISPLAYCLASS></DISPLAYCLASS>
     <SIZE></SIZE>
  </FORMELEMENT>
</FORMELEMENTGROUP>

tag.name: param
tag.description: - Array of Attributes for the Element Group

docblock.description: Adds a standard Form Element Group to a Form "Snippet", with a child Form Element
docblock.long-description:
<FORMELEMENTGROUP>
   <FORMELEMENT>
     <NAME></NAME>
     <DISPLAY></DISPLAY>
     <TYPE></TYPE>
     <DEFAULT></DEFAULT>
     <CLASS></CLASS>
     <VTIP></VTIP>
     <REQUIRED></REQUIRED>
     <DISPLAYCLASS></DISPLAYCLASS>
     <SIZE></SIZE>
  </FORMELEMENT>
</FORMELEMENTGROUP>

docblock.description: Adds a set of Values to a form element, specifically select, radio, or checkbox
docblock.long-description:
If group is specified, a VALUEGROUP element will be appended

 values[0]["sel_key"] = "first";
 values[0]["sel_value"] = "1";
 values[1]["sel_key"] = "second";
 values[1]["sel_value"] = "2";
 XMLForm -> addStyroformValue("someelement",values,true);

docblock.description: Put a specific value in a form element, called most often from the addItem() method, but could be called independently.
docblock.long-description: Specific element types need specific types of defaults, i.e. a text element needs a string, a multi-select needs an array, a date needs a valid date.

docblock.description: As the name suggests, adds an attribute to a specific form element.
docblock.long-description: Some form elements need "default", or "selected" attributes. Useful also for custom XSL Transformations.

docblock.description: Styroform can display a list of data, for CRUD type operations.
docblock.long-description:
Use this to add a list to the form, vis:

llistarray["attribs"] = array("attribname1"=>"attribvalue1","attribname2"=>"attribvalue2");
listarray["items"][0] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
listarray["items"][1] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
listarray["items"][2] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
listarray["items"][3] = array("name1"=>"value2","name2"=>"value2");
XMLForm -> list = listarray;

docblock.description: Adds form elements to the "container" form element group. Elements come from the "container" array.
Adds an HMAC Signature to the form if the "signature" form element group exists.
docblock.long-description: The HMAC Key uses MCRYPT TripleDES, and contains the form name, and a timestamp.

docblock.description: Adds a multidemensional array of values to the form.
docblock.long-description:
Use this to populate the form values with data, viz:

 XMLForm -> item["someformelement"] = "somevalue";

vals["a"] = 1;
vals["b"] = 2;
XMLForm -> item = vals;

This will then run prior to XSL Transformation, and insert appropriate values to the appropriate form element.

docblock.description: Sets the default value of datetime elements if no default data already exists.
Clears the preselected values of a CheckRadio Element
Adds an array to the form, for use in Select and CheckRadio elements
docblock.long-description:
The array isn't a normal two-d array, make sure you use the following format:

$item[0]["sel_key"]="stinky";
$item[0]["sel_value"]="stinky";
$item[1]["sel_key"]="fish";
$item[1]["sel_value"]="fish";

docblock.description: Builds server-side dynamic select lists from MySQL Tables or Arrays
Add an "Other" item to an auto-generated select list, and append to a specific point in that option list.
docblock.long-description:
addOther("last|other",array("first"=>1,"second"=>2,"third"=>3));

This will result in a select list, [first, second, third, other]

 addOther("0|other",array("first"=>1,"second"=>2,"third"=>3));

This will result in a select list, [other, first, second, third]

tag.name: param
tag.description: - The Value to be Added, (pos, value)

docblock.description: Pops a form element modification on the "mods" array, for later inclusion in the Form XML Object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: int Position relative to Base FOrm

docblock.description: Applies items in the mod array to the Form XML Object.
docblock.long-description: Mods are of type "mod, del, hidegroup", but can be extended to have other functions
